label.tb_15_200004300: 200004300 - Impact of person against stationary object. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by the impact of the injured person against the source of the injury, with the movement that originally produced the contact being that of the person and not that of the source of the injury, except when the movement of the injured person was caused by a fall. It includes cases of someone hitting something, stumbling over something, being pushed or thrown at something, etc. It does not include cases of jumping to a lower level.
label.tb_15_200004600: 200004600 - Impact of person against moving object. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by the impact of the injured person against the source of the injury, with the movement that originally produced the contact being that of the person and not that of the source of the injury, except when the movement of the injured person was caused by a fall. It includes cases of someone hitting something, stumbling over something, being pushed or thrown at something, etc. It does not include cases of jumping to a lower level.
label.tb_15_200008300: 200008300 - Impact suffered by person from falling object. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, the movement that originated the contact being from the source of the injury and not from the injured person.
label.tb_15_200008600: 200008600 - Impact suffered by person from projected object. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, the movement that originated the contact being from the source of the injury and not from the injured person.
label.tb_15_200008900: 200008900 - Impact suffered by person, NIC. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, the movement that originated the contact being from the source of the injury and not from the injured person.
label.tb_15_200012200: 200012200 - Fall of a person with level difference from scaffolding, passage, platform, etc. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012300: 200012300 - Fall of a person with level difference from movable or fixed ladder in which the steps do not allow full foot support. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012400: 200012400 - Fall of a person with level difference from stacked material. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012500: 200012500 - Fall of a person with level difference from vehicle. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012600: 200012600 - Fall of a person with level difference in permanent ladder in which the steps allow full foot support. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012700: 200012700 - Fall of a person with level difference on well, excavation, opening in the floor, etc. ( from the opening's edge). Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200012900: 200012900 - Fall of a person with level difference, NIC. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by impact between the injured person and the source of the injury, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The injured person's movement was due to the action of gravity. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was below the surface that supported the injured person at the beginning of the fall. Includes jump to lower level.
label.tb_15_200016300: 200016300 - Fall of a person at the same level in a passage or on a support surface. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by Impact between the injured person and an external object, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The movement of the injured person was due to the action of gravity with loss balance and inability to stand. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was, at the moment of the beginning of the fall, at or above the surface that supported the injured person.
label.tb_15_200016600: 200016600 - Fall of a person at the same level over or against something. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by Impact between the injured person and an external object, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The movement of the injured person was due to the action of gravity with loss balance and inability to stand. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was, at the moment of the beginning of the fall, at or above the surface that supported the injured person.
label.tb_15_200016900: 200016900 - Fall of a person at the same level, NIC. Applies to cases in which the injury was produced by Impact between the injured person and an external object, with the injured person having intiated the movement that produced the contact, in the following circumstances: 1) The movement of the injured person was due to the action of gravity with loss balance and inability to stand. 2) The point of contact with the source of the injury was, at the moment of the beginning of the fall, at or above the surface that supported the injured person.
label.tb_15_200020100: 200020100 - Trapping in, under or between converging moving objects (calender) or with fitting. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by compression, clamping or crushing between a moving object and a stationary one, between two moving objects or between parts of the same object. It does not apply when the source of the injury is a projected or falling object without restrains.
label.tb_15_200020300: 200020300 - Trapping in, under or between stationary and moving object. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by compression, clamping or crushing between a moving object and a stationary one, between two moving objects or between parts of the same object. It does not apply when the source of the injury is a projected or falling object without restrains.
label.tb_15_200020500: 200020500 - Trapping in, under or between two or more moving objects (without fitting). Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by compression, clamping or crushing between a moving object and a stationary one, between two moving objects or between parts of the same object. It does not apply when the source of the injury is a projected or falling object without restrains.
label.tb_15_200020700: 200020700 - Trapping in, under or between landslides or collapse of building, barrier, etc. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by compression, clamping or crushing between a moving object and a stationary one, between two moving objects or between parts of the same object. It does not apply when the source of the injury is a projected or falling object without restrains.
label.tb_15_200020900: 200020900 - Trapping in, under or between, NIC. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by compression, clamping or crushing between a moving object and a stationary one, between two moving objects or between parts of the same object. It does not apply when the source of the injury is a projected or falling object without restrains.
label.tb_15_200024300: 200024300 - Friction or abrasion from touching, stepping, kneeling or sitting on an object (not vibrating). Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200024400: 200024400 - Friction or abrasion from handling an object (not vibrating). Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200024500: 200024500 - Friction or abrasion from vibrating object. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200024600: 200024600 - Friction or abrasion from foreign body in the eye. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200024700: 200024700 - Friction or abrasion from repetitive compression. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200024900: 200024900 - Friction or abrasion, NIC. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was produced by pressure, vibration or friction between the injured person and the source of the injury.
label.tb_15_200028300: 200028300 - Bodily reaction to its movements - involuntary movement (slip without falling, etc.). Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused exclusively by free movement of the human body that caused tension or torsion in some part of the body. Generally applies to the occurrence of sprains, strains, ruptures or other internal injuries, resulting from the adoption of a forced position or involuntary movements caused by startle or effort to recover the normal position in cases of slipping or loss of balance. Includes cases of muscle or internal injury resulting from individual movements such as walking, climbing, running, trying to reach something, turning, bending, etc., when such movements are the source of the injury. It does not apply to over-exertion when lifting, pulling or pushing objects or to cases in which the movement of the body, voluntary or involuntary, has resulted in violent contact with an object.
label.tb_15_200028600: 200028600 - Bodily reaction to its movements - voluntary movement. Applies to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused exclusively by free movement of the human body that caused tension or torsion in some part of the body. Generally applies to the occurrence of sprains, strains, ruptures or other internal injuries, resulting from the adoption of a forced position or involuntary movements caused by startle or effort to recover the normal position in cases of slipping or loss of balance. Includes cases of muscle or internal injury resulting from individual movements such as walking, climbing, running, trying to reach something, turning, bending, etc., when such movements are the source of the injury. It does not apply to over-exertion when lifting, pulling or pushing objects or to cases in which the movement of the body, voluntary or involuntary, has resulted in violent contact with an object.
label.tb_15_200032200: 200032200 - Over-exertion when lifting object. See explanations of the previous classification (200028000).
label.tb_15_200032400: 200032400 - Over-exertion when pushing or pulling an object. See explanations of the previous classification (200028000).
label.tb_15_200032600: 200032600 - Over-exertion when handling, shaking or throwing an object. See explanations of the previous classification (200028000).
label.tb_15_200032900: 200032900 - Over-exertion, NIC. See explanations of the previous classification (200028000).
label.tb_15_200036000: 200036000 - Exposure to electrical energy. Applies only to cases without impact, in which the injury consists of electric shock, burn or electrocution.
label.tb_15_200040300: 200040300 - Contact with object or substance at very high temperature. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury consists of burns, frostbite, etc., the results of burns, frostbite, etc., resulting from contact with hot or cold objects, air, gases, vapors or liquids. It does not apply to cases in which the injury was caused by the toxic or caustic characteristics of chemicals or burns by electrical discharge.
label.tb_15_200040600: 200040600 - Contact with object or substance at very low temperature. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury consists of burns, frostbite, etc., the results of burns, frostbite, etc., resulting from contact with hot or cold objects, air, gases, vapors or liquids. It does not apply to cases in which the injury was caused by the toxic or caustic characteristics of chemicals or burns by electrical discharge.
label.tb_15_200044300: 200044300 - Exposure to high ambient temperature. Does not apply to cases of injury from exposure to solar radiation or other radiation. Also does not apply to cases of burns or frostbite caused by contact with an object or substance at extreme temperatures or burns due to electrical energy.
label.tb_15_200044600: 200044600 - Exposure to low ambient temperature. Does not apply to cases of injury from exposure to solar radiation or other radiation. Also does not apply to cases of burns or frostbite caused by contact with an object or substance at extreme temperatures or burns due to electrical energy.
label.tb_15_200048200: 200048200 - Inhalation of caustic, toxic or harmful substance. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused by inhalation, absorption or ingestion of harmful substances. Generally, refers to intoxication, poisoning, burns, irritation or allergic reactions caused by chemicals.
label.tb_15_200048400: 200048400 - Ingestion of caustic, toxic or harmful substance. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused by inhalation, absorption or ingestion of harmful substances. Generally, refers to intoxication, poisoning, burns, irritation or allergic reactions caused by chemicals.
label.tb_15_200048600: 200048600 - Absorption (by contact) of caustic, toxic or harmful substance. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused by inhalation, absorption or ingestion of harmful substances. Generally, refers to intoxication, poisoning, burns, irritation or allergic reactions caused by chemicals.
label.tb_15_200048900: 200048900 - Inhalation, ingestion or absorption, NIC. Applies only to cases, without impact, in which the injury was caused by inhalation, absorption or ingestion of harmful substances. Generally, refers to intoxication, poisoning, burns, irritation or allergic reactions caused by chemicals.
label.tb_15_200052000: 200052000 - Immersion. Applies to accidents that result in drowning.
label.tb_15_200056000: 200056000 - Exposure to non-ionizing radiation. Applies to cases where the lesions are caused by exposure to solar radiation or other non-ionizing radiation (for example, ultraviolet and infrared).
label.tb_15_200080200: 200080200 - Attack from living being by bite, sting, horn, kick, etc., does not apply in case of venom or disease vector.
label.tb_15_200080600: 200080600 - Attack from disease vector living being.
label.tb_15_200080900: 200080900 - Attack from living being (including humans), NIC.
label.tb_15_200080901: 200080901 - Contact with sick people or infectious material - biological agents.

label.tb_17_702010000: 702010000 - Cut, laceration, blunt wound, puncture (open wound)
label.tb_17_702025000: 702025000 - Inflammation of the joint, tendon or muscle - includes synovitis, tenosynovitis, etc. Does not include strain, sprain or its consequences
label.tb_17_702040000: 702040000 - Burn or scald - high temperature effect. Effect of contact with hot substance. Includes burn by electricity, but does not include electric shock. Does not include chemical substance burn, effects of radiation, sunburn, systemic disability such as heat illness, friction burn, etc.
label.tb_17_702042000: 702042000 - Chemical burn (tissue damage caused by the corrosive action of a chemical, its fumes, etc.)
label.tb_17_702045000: 702045000 - Effects of Radiation (immediate) - sunburn and all forms of tissue, bone or organic fluid damage due to radiation exposure
label.tb_17_702048000: 702048000 - Freezing, frostbite and other effects of exposure to low temperature
label.tb_17_702055000: 702055000 - Heat illness, heat stroke, cramps, exhaustion and other effects of high ambient temperature - does not include sunburn or other radiation effects
label.tb_17_702075000: 702075000 - Loss or reduction of sense (hearing, sight, smell, taste and touch, as long as it is not the result of another injury)
label.tb_17_704020000: 704020000 - Contagious or infectious disease (tuberculosis, brucellosis, etc.)
label.tb_17_704040000: 704040000 - Dermatosis (rash, inflammation of the skin, including boils, etc.). Usually caused by direct contact with sensitizing or irritating substances or agents, such as medicines, oils, biological agents, plants, wood or metals. Does not include injury caused by the corrosive action of chemicals, burns from contact with hot substances, effects of exposure to radiation, effects of exposure to low temperatures or inflammation or irritation caused by friction or impact
label.tb_17_704050000: 704050000 - Systemic poisoning - systemic morbid condition caused by inhalation, ingestion or cutaneous absorption of toxic substance, which affects the metabolism, the functioning of the nervous system, the circulatory system, the digestive system, the respiratory system, the excretion organs, the muscle-skeletal system, etc., includes chemical, medicine, metal or venom action. Does not include effects of radiation, pneumoconiosis, chemical corrosive effect, skin irritation, septicemia or in the case of infected wound
label.tb_17_704060000: 704060000 - Loss or reduction of sense over time (hearing, sight, smell, taste and touch, as long as it is not the result of another injury)
label.tb_17_704070000: 704070000 - Effects of Radiation (over time) - sunburn and all forms of tissue, bone or organic fluid damage due to radiation exposure
label.tb_24_1_0_01: 1.0.01 - Bodily injury that causes death or the loss or reduction, permanent or temporary, of the ability to work, provided that it does not fall under any of the other codes.
label.tb_24_1_0_02: 1.0.02 - Functional disorder that causes death or the loss or reduction, permanent or temporary, of the ability to work, provided that it does not fall under any of the other codes.
label.tb_24_2_0_01: 2.0.01 - Occupational illness, thus understood as one produced or triggered by the exercise of work peculiar to a specific activity and included in the respective list created by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security, provided that it does not fall under any of the other codes.
label.tb_24_2_0_02: 2.0.02 - Work-related illness, thus understood as one acquired or triggered due to special conditions in which the work is performed and directly related to it, included in the respective list created by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security, provided that it does not fall under any of the other codes .
label.tb_24_2_0_03: 2.0.03 - Illness resulting from accidental contamination of the employee in the exercise of their activity.
label.tb_24_2_0_04: 2.0.04 - Endemic disease acquired by an insured inhabitant of the region in which it develops when resulting from exposure or direct contact determined by the nature of the work.
label.tb_24_2_0_05: 2.0.05 - Occupational or work-related illness not included in the list created by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security when resulting from the special conditions in which the work is performed and directly related to it.
label.tb_24_2_0_06: 2.0.06 - Occupational or work-related illness within the scope of the list created by the Ministry of Labor and Social Security regarding the technical epidemiological social security link - NTEP.
label.tb_24_3_0_01: 3.0.01 - Work-related accident that, although it was not the only cause, contributed directly to the death, to the redution or to the loss of the insured person's ability to work, or produced an injury that requires medical attention for their recovery.
label.tb_24_3_0_02: 3.0.02 - Accident suffered by the insured person at the place and time of work, as a result of an act of aggression, sabotage or terrorism practiced by a third party or co-worker.
label.tb_24_3_0_03: 3.0.03 - Accident suffered by the insured person at the place and time of work, as a result of intentional physical offense, including that of a third party, due to a work-related dispute.
label.tb_24_3_0_04: 3.0.04 - Accident suffered by the insured person at the time and place of work, as a result of an act of recklessness, negligence or inability of a third party or co-worker.
label.tb_24_3_0_05: 3.0.05 - Accident suffered by the insured person at the place and time of work, as a result of an act deprived of the use of reason.
label.tb_24_3_0_06: 3.0.06 - Accident suffered by the insured person at the time and place of work, as a result of collapse, flood, fire and other unforeseen circumstances or due to force majeure.
label.tb_24_3_0_07: 3.0.07 - Accident suffered by the insured person, even though outside the workplace and working hours when executing orders or performing services under the authority of the company.
label.tb_24_3_0_08: 3.0.08 - Accident suffered by the insured person even though outside the workplace and working hours and in the spontaneous provision of any service to the company to avoid loss or provide benefit.
label.tb_24_3_0_09: 3.0.09 - Accident suffered by the insured person even though outside the workplace and working hours while traveling in the service of the company, including for study when financed by it within its plans for better training of the workforce, regardless of the means of transportation used, including vehicle owned by the insured person.
label.tb_24_3_0_10: 3.0.10 - Accident suffered by the insured person even though outside the workplace and working hours and on the way from their residence to the workplace or from latter to the former, whatever the means of transportation, including vehicle owned by the insured person.
label.tb_24_3_0_11: 3.0.11 - Accident suffered by the insured person during periods intended for meals or rest, or when performing other physiological needs, at the time or place of work.
label.tb_24_4_0_01: 4.0.01 - Suspicion of occupational or work-related illnesses caused by special working conditions, pursuant to art. 169 of the CLT.
label.tb_24_4_0_02: 4.0.02 - Discover of the occurrence or aggravation of occupational illnesses, through medical examinations that include those defined in NR 07; or have been verified alterations that reveal any type of organ or biological system dysfunction, through the examinations contained in Tables I (only those with SC interpretation) and II, and item 7.4.2.3 of this NR, even without symptoms, that will be the responsibility of the coordinator or supervising doctor.

mensagem.anexo_16_abdomen_normal: Ruidos hidroaéreos presentes, blando, depresible, no dolor a la palpación, no visceromegalia, no tumoraciones.
mensagem.anexo_16_aneis_inguinais_normais: No se palpan masas ni tumoraciones al examen físico.
mensagem.anexo_16_boca_normal: Labios sin alteraciones, mucosa oral húmeda, orofaringe no congestiva, amigdalas no hipertróficas.
mensagem.anexo_16_cancelar_historia_ocupacional: Do you really want to cancel this item? If you continue, this record will not be considered in the occupational history.
mensagem.anexo_16_coluna_vertebral_normal: Rangos articulares y curvaturas conservadas sin dolor a la movilización activa o pasiva.
mensagem.anexo_16_coracao_normal: Ruidos cardiacos rítmicos, de buena intensidad, no se auscultan soplos cardiacos.
mensagem.anexo_16_descancelar_historia_ocupaciona: Do you really want to undo the cancellation of this item?
mensagem.anexo_16_hernias_ausentes: No se palpan masas ni tumoraciones al examen físico.
mensagem.anexo_16_linguagem_normal: Funciones superiores conservadas, lúcido, orientado en tiempo, espacio y persona.
mensagem.anexo_16_marcha_normal: Movimientos alternantes y rítmicos de las extremidades y del tronco que determinan un desplazamiento del centro de gravedad hacia adelante, equilíbrio y locomoción conservados.
mensagem.anexo_16_membros_inferiores_normais: Rangos articulares conservados sin dolor a la movilización activa o pasiva.
mensagem.anexo_16_membros_superiores_normais: Rangos articulares conservados sin dolor a la movilización activa o pasiva.
mensagem.anexo_16_nariz_normal: Fosas nasales permeables, tabique nasal sin desviaciones, cornetes no hipertróficos, no secreciones.
mensagem.anexo_16_orgaos_genitais_normais: De acuerdo a edad y sexo.
mensagem.anexo_16_otoscopia_normal: CAE permeable con tímpano íntegro sin alteraciones.
mensagem.anexo_16_pescoco_normal: Cilíndrico, móvil, no doloroso a la palpación ni a la movilización pasiva ni activa, no adenopatías, tamanho de tiroides dentro de rangos normales, no ingurgitación yugular.
mensagem.anexo_16_pulmoes_normais: Murmullo vesicular pasa bien en ambos campos pulmonares, no se auscultan ruidos agregados.
mensagem.anexo_16_reflexos_pupilares_normais: Pupilas centrales, isocóricas, reactivas a la luz y a la acomodación.
mensagem.anexo_16_torax_normal: Caja torácica sin alteraciones. En las mamas no se palpan nódulos. Axilas sin adenopatías.

mensagem.descricao_atividades_complementares_warn: Use the space below to describe activities that are complementary to the activities already described. These activities will be displayed in the PGR, but will NOT be sent to eSocial.
mensagem.descricao_atividades_ghe: Brief description of the set of activities or tasks performed by the HGE components, in order to detail their routine (usual) and occasional (occasional) work cycle, reporting: What do you do? With what resource and/or equipment? How often? It is desirable that each sentence starts with the verb in the infinitive: Example: Accomplish, plan, execute, guide, participate, inspect, etc. If this information is used to generate the PPP, the description of the activity must contain a maximum of 400 characters, as established in IN 18/2016. For eSocial, the description of activities must be a maximum of 999 characters.
mensagem.descricao_atividades_warning_ghe: According to eSocial event S-2240, the character limit for describing activities will be 999. The character counter located on the lower right side of the 'Activity Description' field displays the number of characters remaining. The system will not block the description when it reaches the limit, since more than 999 characters can be described as long as the periods of performance of the activities are different.

tooltip.higiene_ghe_matriz_aposentadoria_especia: The right to social security benefit (special retirement) is due to quantitative agents, when the exposure is above the LT and for qualitative agents, provided that: 1. The activity where the equivalence occurs has been classified as “Habitual” in its frequency.
tooltip.higiene_ghe_matriz_insalubridade: Insalubrity can be classified as a minimum (10%), medium (20%) or maximum (40%) degree according to its classification within the annexes of NR15. For quantitative risks it will not be necessary to establish the degree. For qualitative risks, their selection will be mandatory for cases in which there is classification by the NR (check classification according to activities described in the respective annexes of the standard), provided that the activity where the exposure occurs has been classified as “Habitual” in its frequency.
